page.title: 14COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: In Alford we have a{post office}with a{sorting office}at the back. It is about 85 years old and was built as a post office . On average it handles 3,000 letters, 700 to 800 packets and 150 parcels a day .There are 6 rural rounds and 3 in the town . They have 9 vans and 4 bicycles. Our mail is first sent to an automatic sorting machine office at Doncaster. There are{1600 {telephone lines}in Alford. In Alford exchange 9-10am is the busy hour. The exchange was built in 1939 and is a {Strowger}type. Up to 100 calls are dealt with at any one time. Each engineer has a vehicle of his own. Every telephone has its own meter for charging the subscriber. These are situated in the exchange. 3 engineers normally work at the exchange. The annual maintenance cost is{Â£30,000.
